entry.title: MERKLEY DENOUNCES REPUBLICAN EFFORTS TO SELL OFF PUBLIC LANDS
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 3:30 p.m. On Monday, Oregon’s U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley released a statement following reports that the GOP’s “One Big, Beautiful Bill” includes provisions that would allow the federal government to sell off millions of acres of federal lands, including thousands of acres in Oregon. Merkley said, “Our public lands – which contribute...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 6.16.25
entry.summary: Terry Brock, Cody Clark and Tom Maddux talk about the upcoming Sutherlin Stampede which includes new events that are being added for this year.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 6.16.25
entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Representative Court Boice talks about last week’s decision from the Fish and Wildlife Commission, current hot topics in the legislature, and what remains before adjournment later this month.

entry.title: BLM CANCELS PRESCRIBED BURN SCHEDULE FOR THIS WEEK
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 11:00 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management, Roseburg District, has canceled its prescribed burn schedule for this week. The agency was preparing for a 122-acre prescribed burn within the North Umpqua Management Area, six miles west of Glide, off North Bank Road. BLM Public Affairs Specialist Joey Nikirk said the cancelation decision...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL FUGITIVE SUNDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: June 16, 2025 10:50 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a fugitive on Sunday night. An RPD report said officers contacted the 41-year-old in the 1000 block of Northeast Stephens Street and arrested him on a Douglas County Circuit Court warrant. He was detained without bail.

entry.title: 10 Douglas County organizations boosted by Three Rivers Foundation grants
entry.summary: FLORENCE — As agencies and organizations see state and federal funding slashed nationwide, child advocacy organization Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) has looked towards private grants amidst the uncertainty, according to CASA of Douglas County Executive Director Angela Gross.

entry.title: Troubled waters: Wild fall chinook salmon fishing is facing new restrictions
entry.summary: For many in Oregon, fall means fishing season as anglers take to the water with hopes of reeling in flavorful wild-caught fall chinook salmon. The ODFW is expecting a solid fishing season in most coastal rivers, but one in particular…

entry.title: Event kicks off Habitat for Humanity housing project in Riddle
entry.summary: RIDDLE — As Brandy Blankenship walked up a dusty dirt slope, surveying the land that will make her a first-time homeowner, she didn’t stop smiling.

entry.title: YMCA of Douglas County launches summer programs
entry.summary: As summer break begins, parents throughout Douglas County are looking for opportunities to keep their children active, safe and socially engaged. Research shows that many children experience a significant decline in both academic skills and physical activity during the summer…
